title: How to Set Up a Wireless Printer Connection

steps.title: Place the printer within range of your wireless router.
steps.content: Place the printer within range of your wireless router. Most modern printers have Wi-Fi capability, allowing you to set them up without connecting to any of your computers. The printer will need to be in range of your wireless router in order to connect to it. If your printer does not have wireless capabilities, you will need to connect it to your computer using a USB cable.

steps.title: Power on the printer.
steps.content: Power on the printer. You'll be connecting to the wireless network directly from the printer, so you don't need to connect it to a computer first. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Connect the printer to your wireless network.
steps.content: Connect the printer to your wireless network. The process for this will vary depending on the printer. You'll need to know your Wi-Fi network name ( SSID ) and password. [2] X Research source Many printers will allow you to connect to the wireless network using the built-in menu system. Refer to the printer's documentation for the exact location. If you can't find your manual, you can almost always download a PDF copy from the manufacturer's support site. If your printer and router both support WPS push-to-connect, simply push the WPS button on your printer, then press the WPS button on your router within two minutes. The connection will be made automatically. Some older wireless printers may require you to connect to a computer first to set up the wireless connection. This is common if the printer doesn't have a built-in menu, but does support wireless. Connect the printer to your computer via USB, and use the included software to set up the printer's wireless connection. After configuring its wireless, you can disconnect it from your computer and place it where you want.

steps.title: Connect your printer to the wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your printer to the wireless network. Use the steps above to make sure your printer is connected to the wireless network. Follow the instructions in the user's manual that came with your printer if you need help. Your computer and printer need to be connected to the same wireless network.

steps.title: Click the Windows Start menu .
steps.content: Click the Windows Start menu . It's the icon with the Windows logo in the lower-right corner. This opens the Windows Start menu. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Settings icon.
steps.content: Click the Settings icon. It's the icon that resembles a gear on the left side of the Windows Start menu. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Devices.
steps.content: Click Devices . It has an icon that resembles a keyboard and an iPod. It's in the Windows Settings menu.

steps.title: Click Printers & scanners.
steps.content: Click Printers & scanners . It's in the menu bar to the left next to an icon that resembles a printer.

steps.title: Click + Add printer or scanner.
steps.content: Click + Add printer or scanner . It's at the top of the menu next to a plus (+) sign. Your computer will start scanning for printers and scanners connected to the network.

steps.title: Click your printer and click Add devices.
steps.content: Click your printer and click Add devices . When your computer discovers the printer, it will be listed below "Add printers and scanners." It will most likely be listed as your printer's manufacturer and model. Click your printer and then click Add Device below the printer's name and manufacturer. This adds your printer to your computer. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If your printer is not listed, click The printer that I want isn't listed . This displays options to help you find an older printer, add a shared printer by name, TCP/IP address, wirelessly, or locally using manual settings. Select an option and follow the instructions to connect your printer.

steps.title: Click Print to print a page.
steps.content: Click Print to print a page. Depending on the app you are using, you can find the "Print" option under the "File" menu, or by clicking the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) in the upper-left corner. In some cases, you can just click an icon that resembles a printer in the menu bar at the top of the screen. View the print preview and click Print to print to your printer. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Connect your printer to the Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your printer to the Wi-Fi network. Use the steps outlined above and in the user's manual for your printer to connect your printer to your wireless network. Your printer and your Mac need to be connected to the same wireless network.

steps.title: Update your Mac.
steps.content: Update your Mac. Updating your Mac ensures that your computer has all the latest printer information. If your printer uses AirPrint, this isn't necessary. Use the following steps to update your Mac: [7] X Research source Open the App Store . Click the Updates tab. Click Update All .

steps.title: Click the Apple menu .
steps.content: Click the Apple menu . It's the icon that resembles an apple in the upper-right corner. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click System Preferences….
steps.content: Click System Preferences… . It's near the top of the Apple menu. This opens the System Preferences menu.

steps.title: Click Printer & Scanners.
steps.content: Click Printer & Scanners . This displays a list of connected printers (if any) on the left side. If you see your printer listed, it is already connected. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . It's at the bottom of the box with all the connected printers on the left. Your Mac will scan for printers connected to your wireless network.

steps.title: Click your printer and click Add.
steps.content: Click your printer and click Add . This connects to your printer. [10] X Research source For some printers, you may need to connect your printer to your Mac with a USB cord and install the drivers that came with the printer or from the manufacturer's websites. Then connect your printer to the wireless network. Once it is connected, you can disconnect the USB cable.

steps.title: Click Print to print a page.
steps.content: Click Print to print a page. Depending on the app you are using, you can find the "Print" option under the "File" menu, or by clicking the icon with three dots ( ⋮ ) in the upper-left corner. In some cases, you can just click an icon that resembles a printer in the menu bar at the top of the screen. View the print preview and click Print to print to your printer. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Connect your printer to the wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your printer to the wireless network. Use the steps above to make sure your printer is connected to the wireless network. Follow the instructions in the user's manual that came with your printer if you need help. Make sure your wireless printer and your Android phone are connected to the same wireless network.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . It generally has an icon that resembles a gear.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon .
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon . It's in the upper-right corner of the Settings menu. This allows you to quickly search for different menu items in the Settings menu. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Type Printing in the search bar.
steps.content: Type Printing in the search bar. This shows where the printing option is in the Settings menu. This option is located in different locations depending on which Android model you have. On stock Android, it's located under "Connected devices > Connection Preferences > Printing." [13] X Research source On Samsung Galaxy, it's located under "Connections > More Connection Settings > Printing."

steps.title: Tap Printing.
steps.content: Tap Printing . This opens the Printing menu which allows you to select a print service plugin.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch to turn a print service plugin on.
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch to turn a print service plugin on. Most Android models have the Default Print Service plugin. Tap the toggle switch next to this to turn it on. If you are using a Samsung Galaxy, you also have the option of using the Samsung Print Service plugin. You can use either plugin. [14] X Research source Alternatively, you can tap Download Plugin to open the Google Play Store and download a third-party print service plugin. Many printer manufacturers such as HP, Canon, Brother, and Lexmark have their own print service plugin you can use. Tap the third-party plugin you want to use and tap Install.

steps.title: Tap the print service plugin you want to use.
steps.content: Tap the print service plugin you want to use. All installed print service plugins are listed in the Printing Settings menu. This scans for printers connected to your wireless network. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your printer.
steps.content: Tap your printer. This connects your printer to your Android phone or tablet.

steps.title: Tap Print to print.
steps.content: Tap Print to print. If an app you are using supports printing, you can find the option to print by tapping the menu icon, which usually resembles three dots or lines ("⋯", "⋮", or "☰") in the upper-right or left corner. Then tap Print . View the print preview and tap Print to print to your printer. [16] X Research source Not all apps support printing. However, you can take screenshots and print those.

steps.title: Determine if your printer supports AirPrint.
steps.content: Determine if your printer supports AirPrint. This feature allows iOS devices to send print jobs directly to the printer. Look for the AirPrint logo on your printer or for an AirPrint option in the printer's Settings menu. [17] X Research source Some printers need to be configured to use AirPrint first. AirPrint printers will need to be connected to the same network as your iOS device. Follow the steps at the top of this article to connect your printer to the network. If your printer doesn't support AirPrint, you'll need to find a printing app from your printer's manufacturer.

steps.title: Open the app that you want to print from.
steps.content: Open the app that you want to print from. Not all apps support AirPrint, but most apps from Apple and other major developers do. You'll be most likely to find AirPrint options in apps that can open documents, email, and pictures. [18] X Research source If an app doesn't support printing, you can take screenshots and print those.

steps.title: Open the item you want to print.
steps.content: Open the item you want to print. Use the app to open the document, picture, or email that you want to print. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Share button and select AirPrint.
steps.content: Tap the Share button and select AirPrint . This will allow you to select your AirPrint printer. [20] X Research source Make sure you're connected to the same network as the printer.

steps.title: Select your printer and tap Print.
steps.content: Select your printer and tap Print . Your file will be sent to your AirPrint printer.
